sentences.en: ...a gruelling trip that would have daunted a woman half her age.
sentences.cn: …即使是只有她一半年纪的女人都会感到胆怯的一次痛苦旅行。

sentences.en: Any affairs in the world can't daunt the outstanding Chinese people.
sentences.cn: 天下事难不倒锐意进取的中国人民.

sentences.en: Don’t be daunted by all the technology.
sentences.cn: 不要被所有这些技术给吓住。

sentences.en: Even a greater natural calamity cannot daunt us.
sentences.cn: 再大的自然灾害也压不垮我们.

sentences.en: He felt utterly daunted by the prospect of moving to another country.
sentences.cn: 他一想到要移居别的国家就感到十分害怕。
什么威胁也吓不倒我们.

sentences.en: nothing daunted, the committee set to work.
sentences.cn: 委员会无所畏惧地开始工作了。

sentences.en: Once we master it, no material difficulty can daunt us.
sentences.cn: 我们学会了这一条, 我们就对一切物质困难都不怕了.

sentences.en: Only heroes can quell tigers and leopards. And wild bears never daunt the brave.
sentences.cn: 独有英雄驱虎豹, 更无豪杰怕熊罴.

sentences.en: The difficulty did not daunt him.
Their guide deserted them, but, nothing daunt, they press on into the jungle.
sentences.cn: 向导离他们而去, 但是他们毫不气馁, 仍向森林进发.

sentences.en: Unarmed policemen did not daunt him, neither did the cars in the streets.
sentences.cn: 不要说是个赤手空拳的巡警, 就是那满街横行的汽车,他也不怕.

sentences.en: Yhough the prospect of a north wall may daunt new gardeners, it presents few problems.
sentences.cn: 尽管一堵北面的墙其设计前景可能让园艺新手们气馁, 但它对攀援植物来说却没什么问题.

words.tran_cn: 使人畏缩的；使人气馁的；令人怯步的
无畏的；勇敢的；不屈不挠的

trans.tran_en: If something daunts you, it makes you feel slightly afraid or worried about dealing with it
to make someone feel afraid or less confident about something
